TopicTitle: Volumetric ring system - Rings with EVE

Articles.Content:
I didn't wanted to use Kittopia in my RSS config but I wanted rings. So I've created volumetric Rings with the help of EVE, I'm pretty happy with the result, look at it:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

they have proper depth this way and aren't just flat. I could make Gilly a mid-ring-object as I wanted, and you can fly through them. Although the detail-volumetrics don't work quite right yet. I'm not too common with EVE so I might have to further look into it to get more volume. And the Shadowed area is a little big, because how EVE handles that.

But apart from that I'm pretty satisfied so far.

Tell me how you like them.

You can check out how the config looks in my RSS-config.

Just wanted to show the rings to the public, since I think rings weren't made with EVE before.

Cheers

SkyRex 94

Edited February 8, 2015 by SkyRex94
Wow, this is actually really cool. Hopefully they'll update the rings from Better Atmospheres to use this.

Is that Jool?

i need green rings for my jool. I pn all my concept arts, I have depicted jool with green rings, and I need so me one to make them before I start my jool mission, and you look like a go-to guy.

I'll give you rep, too.

wait. I already repped that post.

darnit.

EDIT: if you do so, try to make the rings extend to near laythe.

Edited February 8, 2015 by Rolanvorxariat
Awesome job there, the rings look pretty nice.

I'm not a fan of scales above 3.2x, but that's an awesome looking planet with amazing rings. Good job

GP2 confirmed?!?!

Disclaimer: I'm a big fan of the color blue. There might be some bias happening here ~
Although it looks great, I don't think planetary rings are possible this close to the host star. And not with a planet like Eve.

Very nice! Cheers to NathanKell for directing me here I don't usually hang out on these parts of the forums. I have a question, unless you were going for that style, why are there so many gaps in the ring system? I assume it takes it's toll on performance especially when it loads the volumetrics? Or that it'd be a pain to continuously write it out on the config/GUI?

I would recommend upgrading to the Overhaul for such a thing as it's a lot easier to work with and has some more features but it handles shadows weirdly. Anywhoo, looks very nice!

Although it looks great, I don't think planetary rings are possible this close to the host star. And not with a planet like Eve.

I don't think he'S talking about the planet Eve.

E.V.E. for Environmental Visual Enhancements

This looks great. It would be great if we could use some of these to polish off the standard RSS. ringed Saturn, Uranus and Neptune....

Really looks great.

Nicely done.
Can you do something simmilar for Stock Jool ? I do not play RSS and I am not planning to play it in the near future. But this would looks great on some stock planets. Thanks

I don't think he'S talking about the planet Eve.

E.V.E. for Environmental Visual Enhancements

It took me a while to realise that myself.

Although it looks great, I don't think planetary rings are possible this close to the host star. And not with a planet like Eve.

EVE = Enviromental Visual Enhancements

Can you do something simmilar for Stock Jool ? I do not play RSS and I am not planning to play it in the near future. But this would looks great on some stock planets. Thanks

It was really tedious to do them. That are like ca.50 cloud layers above each other. So I'm really not tempted to do them for Jool, especially since my image of Jool is a Jupiter analouge (which has so thin rings that you can scratch them away).

But if you have the fun for it, you can just copy the cloud config, write everywhere where 'Ike' is a 'Jool', change the heights everywhere, since they are for a 27000km radius gas giant right now, and change the colors of every ring to the color you like

Very nice! Cheers to NathanKell for directing me here I don't usually hang out on these parts of the forums. I have a question, unless you were going for that style, why are there so many gaps in the ring system? I assume it takes it's toll on performance especially when it loads the volumetrics? Or that it'd be a pain to continuously write it out on the config/GUI?

I would recommend upgrading to the Overhaul for such a thing as it's a lot easier to work with and has some more features but it handles shadows weirdly. Anywhoo, looks very nice!

I tried the Overhaul before and I'm not sure what you mean exactly, how would it be easier with the Overhaul?

And yes the gaps come from the gaps of the cloud layers. It was partially intended and partially performance wise. You can double or triple the layer number but than you really start to get some performance lag while flying close to them

@everybody: I'm glad you like them. I really wonder why noone has tried this with EVE before (the mod, not the planet).

This is more of an Add On Affair rather than a General Discussion, moving.

Beautiful rings, SkyRex.

I already tried this option in the past http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/70693-WIP-Renaissance-Compilation-%28artworks-remake%29?p=1002657&viewfull=1#post1002657 but I'm afraid this option has the same problem as a flat ring: still looks pretty rare from some perspectives. Anyways, good work!
